Slow science? Part 2

09 March 2021  

Publications, Sciences, Research  

Projects

When I was working in another institute, the way to prepare the project proposal was as follows: you select a topic that you manage very well and then propose tasks and deliverables that consist of things that you have already done in the past.

Of course you don’t tell it, but you ask for a significant amount of man X months to achieve that task. The goal: to get “fresh money”, that you can spend on other unrelated projects. We cannot really blame that way of doing, let’s say “it’s the system that wants that”, even if that’s wrong. At the same time, an alternative exists, I’ve worked in other places where, in projects, you simply propose new, innovative developments, and then you do what it takes to get the results.

Conferences

Publications

Yes, we all know: “Publish or perish”. The first time I read that, I though it might be true, but I thought it was going to change. And I was wrong.
